description.raw:
While working on pull request #1456, I found the need for a function to return the angular momentum of a Link (inertia matrix times the angular velocity). I've added a test here based on conservation of angular momentum with gyroscopic tumbling of a box with relative dimensions 1x4x9, which looks [something like this](https://vimeo.com/105581956). With no external torques acting, the angular momentum of the box should be constant in the world frame.

In 1879a77e48a0, the tolerance is such that only ODE and simbody pass the test. In 8263602eb9df, I set a flag to enable consideration of gyroscopic forces in bullet, which allows bullet to pass. In ee2df6af178a, I relax the tolerance for dart to allow it to pass. This is something I've discussed with the dart developers, though I don't think there's an issue in any issue tracker yet.

I also fixed a [warning on OS X in physics_collision.cc](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-homebrew-amd64-2/20/warnings6Result/package.-566429772/).

I've added a test here based on conservation of angular momentum with gyroscopic tumbling of a box with relative dimensions 1x4x9, which looks something like this. With no external torques acting, the angular momentum of the box should be constant in the world frame.

In 1879a77e48a0, the tolerance is such that only ODE and simbody pass the test. In 8263602eb9df, I set a flag to enable consideration of gyroscopic forces in bullet, which allows bullet to pass. In ee2df6af178a, I relax the tolerance for dart to allow it to pass. This is something I've discussed with the dart developers, though I don't think there's an issue in any issue tracker yet.

I also fixed a warning on OS X in physics_collision.cc.

title.raw: Add Link::GetWorldAngularMomentum, enable bullet gyroscopic forces
